page.title: 14The George Reservoir
page.content: At Worlds End bore holes are sunk to a depth of 250 feet to obtain water. The water is then treated with a small quantity of chlorine and then pumped to the George Reservoir. The Reservoir was built in 1952 and was constructed of reinforced concrete and is hidden under a grassy mound on the top of Portsdown Hill. It has a depth of 20.5 feet, holds 2 million gallons of water and feeds Cosham, Waterlooville, and Purbrook. It is amazing that you cannot even see the George Reservoir exists - the mound looks so natural.
